subject: Re: [junit] JUnit behaviour
msgSnippet: My first guess without a closer look at the code would be that it s done so that @Before(Class) methods in subclasses are run before those in superclasses. I
messageBody:
My first guess without a closer look at the code would be that it's done
so that @Before(Class) methods in subclasses are run before those in
superclasses.

I don't think there is any guarantee on the order of methods inside one
class. I could be wrong, though.

Cheers, Ilja

jonhnnyweslley schrieb:
> I was creating tests, when in any test I dont understand a behaviour
> of the framework. The Junit framework executes Before and BeforeClass
> test methods in reverse order. Why?
>
> In TestIntrospector I find the below code, but I dont understand the
> cause.
>
> public List<Method> getTestMethods(
> Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass) {
> ...
> if (runsTopToBottom(annotationClass))
> Collections.reverse(results);
> return results;
> }
>
> private boolean runsTopToBottom(
> Class< ? extends Annotation> annotation) {
> return annotation.equals(Before.class) ||
> annotation.equals(BeforeClass.class);
> }
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
